text: Sierra County is a county in the U.S. state of New Mexico. As of the 2020 census, the population was 11,576. Its county seat is Truth or Consequences. ==Economy== ===Launching of spacecraft=== Spaceport America - the spaceport of Virgin Galactic - is located in Sierra County, 45 miles (72 kilometers) north of Las Cruces and 30 miles (48 kilometers) east of Truth or Consequences. Sierra County voters approved the creation of a spaceport tax district in April 2008, freeing up funding for its construction. The first launch from Spaceport America happened in 2006; There have been over 300 launches. On May 22, 2021, Virgin Galactic's VSS Unity launched from the spaceport with three people aboard becoming the first crewed launch from both Spaceport America and New Mexico; New Mexico became the third U.S. state, after California and Florida, to send humans into space. ==References== Category:New Mexico counties Category:1880s establishments in New Mexico Territory Category:1884 establishments in the United States
title: Sierra County, New Mexico
